content.div:
Madonna's new single, "Give Me All Your Luvin'," has an official release date: Friday, Feb. 3.

It also has its requisite, accompanying record sleeve. (The art was released Sunday; please refer to the photo above -- the one featuring Madge pulling at threadbare chemises from the juniors section.)

And as every pop single, particularly a Madonna single, needs a music video to help promote it, we'll be getting one of those, as well -- Feb. 3, apparently -- though first, the clip will be teased on American Idol Thursday, Feb. 2 -- something we know because there's already a teaser for that teaser.

We've posted that commercial for a commercial for a commercial below -- and, if you squint through all the Idol-related subtitles, you should be able to make out a few seconds of Madonna and cohorts M.I.A. and Nicki Minaj -- plus plenty of pom-poms and football players, lest you forget Madge is booked for the Super Bowl Feb. 5. Considering the preview is a mere 10 seconds, we can't tell whether the background talent bears any resemblance to the cast of W.E. -- but why would the Queen of Pop pass on a new marketing opportunity? Guess we'll have to wait until Friday to see if, to use the football parlance, she dropped the ball.

According to Billboard, Megaforce helmed the video -- as in the director responsible for the cartoon violence of Is Tropical's "The Greeks" (watch it), not the 1982 Barry Bostwick movie. The song, as previously reported, was co-written by Madonna, Martin Solveig, Nicki Minaj and M.I.A. Interested music-buyers will be able to purchase it exclusively on iTunes Feb. 3 - 6.

MDNA, Madonna's first album since 2008's Hard Candy, arrives March 26.

leahc@dose.ca

link.Abstract: Madonna's 12th album will be called M.D.N.A. Get it? It's like "Madonna" without the vowels (and that extra letter "N"). Or is it? We've got some theories on what M.D.N.A. stands for.

entry.title: Elton John and David Furnish Slam Madonna's Golden Globe Win

link.Abstract: Elton John's husband, David Furnish, trashed Madonna on Facebook after she won the Golden Globe for Best Original Song.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: In a diva-licious showdown, Madonna and Elton John were both nominated for Best Original Song (Madonna was up for "Masterpiece" from W.E. and John was nominated for "Hello Hello" from Gnomeo & Juliet).
link.title: In a diva-licious showdown, Madonna and Elton John were both nominated for Best Original Song (Madonna was up for "Masterpiece" from W.E. and John was nominated for "Hello Hello" from Gnomeo & Juliet).

link.Abstract: The 69th Golden Globe awards Sunday spread its honour among The Artist, The Help, The Descendants, and several other films.
link.title: Golden Globe Winners

link.Abstract: We chatted live during the Golden Globes. Read out thoughts on the night's best and worst fashion, speeches and winners.
link.title: Recap: Golden Globes Live Chat

link.Abstract: See the stars as you've never seen them before: drunk. Here's your insider look inside the Golden Globes parties.
link.title: Photos: Inside the Golden Globes Afterparties

link.Abstract: From photobombs to penis jokes, take a look at the highs and lows from the Golden Globe Awards.
